alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Essex; Franklin; St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 02 at 10:23PM EST until February 02 at 11:15PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Clinton County in northern New York... Southern Franklin County in northern New York... Southeastern St. Lawrence County in northern New York... Essex County in northern New York... Western Lamoille County in northwestern Vermont... Northwestern Orleans County in northeastern Vermont... Northwestern Addison County in central Vermont... Grand Isle County in northwestern Vermont... Chittenden County in northwestern Vermont... Franklin County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 1115 PM EST. * At 1021 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 25 miles north of Shad Island to near Sciota to near Childwold, moving east at 55 mph. Thundersnow has also been observed. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 87 between mile markers 93 and 94, and between mile markers 96 and 176. Interstate 89 between mile markers 73 and 129. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, Plattsburgh International Airport, Burlington, Tupper Lake, Burlington International Airport, Saranac Lake, Adirondack Regional Airport, Plattsburgh, South Burlington, Vergennes, Lake Placid, Peru, Beekmantown, Schuyler Falls, Moriah, Chazy, Saranac, Altona, Willsboro and Enosburg Falls. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
